meanings.definition: A part of a newspaper or magazine devoted to fiction, criticism, or light literature.
meanings.sent1: I always enjoy reading the feuilletons in the newspaper for some light entertainment.
meanings.sent2: The feuilletons in the magazine provide a nice break from the serious news articles.
meanings.sent3: The feuilletons in the paper made me chuckle with their funny stories.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a collection of feuilletons, each story more captivating than the last.
meanings.sent5: The feuilletons painted a vivid picture of imaginary worlds in my mind.

meanings.definition: A short literary composition often dealing with a single subject and published in a periodical.
meanings.sent1: The author's feuilletons in the magazine were always thought-provoking.
meanings.sent2: I look forward to reading the feuilletons in the literary journal every month.
meanings.sent3: The feuilletons in the newspaper were like bite-sized stories to enjoy with my morning coffee.
meanings.sent4: Her words danced on the page, each feuilleton a glimpse into her creative mind.
meanings.sent5: The feuilletons were like little gems hidden among the pages of the publication.
